The proposed 2020 budget includes a net: 777 billion reduction in Medicaid spending and funding for the Affordable Care Act marketplace subsidies over 10 years.
The proposed spending reductions for Med: 515 billion to $575 billion over 10 years, which is 5 to 5.6 percent of projected Medicare spending over the next decade.
Some Democrats have misleadingly used a: 1.5 trillion in Medicaid cuts and $845 billion in Medicare cuts, which includes programs proposed to be moved to other parts of the budget.
The Medicare proposals in Trump: s budget are similar to cost-cutting measures espoused by Obama during his presidency, which were criticized by Republicans at the time.
